import { useState } from "react"; import "./App.css"; const arrGrocery=[]; const arrVeggies=[]; const arrTravelling=[]; const arrMiscellaneous=[]; let numbers={income:0,expense:0,balance:0} function App() { const[Numbers,setNumbers]=useState(numbers) const addIncome=()=>{ let amt=document.getElementById("incomeAmount").value; numbers.income+=parseFloat(amt).toFixed(2); numbers.balance+=parseFloat(amt).toFixed(2); setNumbers({...numbers}) } const addExpense=()=>{ let text=document.getElementById("expenseText").value let amt=document.getElementById("expenseAmount").value numbers.expense+=parseFloat(amt).toFixed(2); numbers.balance-=parseFloat(amt).toFixed(2); setNumbers({...numbers}) } return ( <>

); } export default App;
